page.title: 14HOBBIES-WAYNE'S GOAT HERD
page.content: Wayne Simmonds, a pupil at Croesty Primary School, helps his grandfather run a goat herd of ten females and one male. They keep a herd of Saanen goats which can be recognised by their short, white hair. The milk from the goats is sometimes sold locally or made into cheese, fruit yogurt or soft cottage cheese. There is a lot of work involved in looking after these animals but the family enjoy this hobby. The family also keep bees in forty hives made by Wayne's grandfather, who was a carpenter. Even when covered by protective clothing the family have to be very careful when dealing with the bees. Again the honey produced is sold locally and is enjoyed by many people in Pencoed. Wayne enjoys these hobbies.
